description.narrative: Benefits to consumers: By enhancing its retail chain, the Group will be able to provide access to a more diverse selection of high-quality, affordable products than most Belarusian consumers currently have access to. Stronger bargaining positions vis-a-vis suppliers, economies of scale achieved through geographical expansion, as well as improved inventory management, will allow for cost savings, which eventually can be passed on to the end customer; Supply chain development: The Group''s expansion will (i) increase the number of its local suppliers, (ii) provide additional sales channels for local producers and importers, as well as (iii) contribute to improvements in efficiency and operating standards throughout the supply chain. Employment generation: The Project will provide additional direct employment for approximately 2,500 people 80% of whom are expected to be women. Five of the Project stores will be greenfield construction projects, so temporary jobs will be created during the construction phase. In addition, indirect employment will be created in the retail value chain. Best practice transfer: The Project is expected to facilitate the transfer of modern retail techniques to Belarusian regions and to enhance the efficiency of the supply chain in the country. The Project will also create a standard for employee training and development across the country. Demonstration effect: The Project will have a demonstration effect by encouraging other companies in the region, as well as Western investors, to pursue investment opportunities in Belarus as the country tries to improve its business climate and facilitate greater inflows of foreign direct investment. In addition, the Project will have a demonstration effect for private sector activity in general by showing the capacity of a private sector company to meet effectively and professionally the needs of the population in a predominantly state-dominated economy.

Rubliovskiy (Rubliovskiy or the Client) is planning to open 21 new stores and acquire 4 existing stores with a combined trade area of over 30 thousand square meters (sqm) in 2012-2014. Rubliovskiy is the leading wholesaler and 5th largest food retailer in Belarus. The client owns and operates a chain of 45 stores and 9 warehouses throughout Belarus. The expansion contemplated by Rubliovskiy will allow it to expand on its success to-date by tapping into significantly underserved regional markets, expand its market share in Minsk and strengthen its overall competitive position.

mailing-address.narrative: Elena Moiseenko Member of the Board of Directors E-mail: mailto:e_moiseenko@rtl.by Phone: 375 17 284-72-71

RTL has its own web-portal where information about the Company, its operations and news are reported. This is also where RTL disclose general project information, in addition to the local disclosures carried out for individual terminal developments: rtl.by Smolenskaya str., 25, of. 617, Minsk. , 220088 Belarustel.\fax +375 17 284-72-71 E-mail: mailto:e_moiseenko@rtl.by

name.narrative: Rubliovskiy is headquartered in Minsk. The company has 45 retail stores and provides logistics and distribution services using its own warehouse nearby Minsk and 9 leased warehouses throughout Belarus.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: Q-BA - Retail (Including Supermarkets, Grocery Stores, etc.)

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
